quote: You see, but you do not observe.
author: Sherlock Holmes

quote: When you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.
author: Sherlock Holmes

quote: It is a capital mistake to theorize before one has data.
author: Sherlock Holmes

quote: There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.
author: Sherlock Holmes

quote: The world is full of obvious things which nobody by any chance ever observes.
author: Sherlock Holmes

quote: A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone.
author: Tyrion Lannister

quote: To observe without evaluating is the highest form of intelligence.
author: J. Krishnamurti

quote: Believe nothing you hear, and only one half that you see.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: The most intricate crimes are often solved by the simplest of observations.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: An ounce of logic is worth a pound of luck.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: It is the brain, the little grey cells on which one must rely.
author: Hercule Poirot

quote: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: It is not that I'm so smart, but I stay with the questions longer.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The important thing is not to stop questioning.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I can calculate the motion of heavenly bodies but not the madness of people.
author: Isaac Newton

quote: Small minds are concerned with the extraordinary, great minds with the ordinary.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself—and you are the easiest person to fool.
author: Richard Feynman

quote: I would rather have questions that can’t be answered than answers that can’t be questioned.
author: Richard Feynman

quote: It is not enough to have a good mind. The main thing is to use it well.
author: René Descartes

quote: I think, therefore I am.
author: René Descartes

quote: A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: The eyes see only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
author: Henri Bergson

quote: All men can see the tactics of conquest, but only the clever can see the strategy.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: The greatest minds are capable of the greatest vices as well as of the greatest virtues.
author: René Descartes

quote: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

quote: The more you know, the more you realize you don't know.
author: Aristotle

quote: Even the wisest cannot see all ends.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: A detective sees where others see nothing.
author: Unknown

quote: Observation is the key to unlocking all mysteries.
author: Unknown

quote: Smart people learn from everything and everyone.
author: Socrates

quote: The most intelligent people are the most introspective.
author: Unknown

quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

quote: Nothing strengthens authority so much as silence.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Learning without thought is labor lost.
author: Confucius

quote: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: One’s intelligence can be measured by the questions they ask, not the answers they give.
author: Unknown

quote: Wit is educated insolence.
author: Aristotle

quote: A cunning mind sees through the fog others live in.
author: Unknown
